title.narrative: International Center for Research on Women Partnership 2018-2020

description.narrative: ICRW will conduct research, coalition-building and targeted policy dialogues to advance a more nuanced approach to women¿s economic empowerment in various multilateral forums. Outreach will be an important part of the project.

participating-org.narrative: Partnership International Center for Research on Women

sector.narrative: Women's rights organisations and movements, and government institutions

policy-marker.narrative: Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention on Biological Diversity
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Convention to Combat Desertification
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Adaptation
Aid Targeting the Objectives of the Framework Convention on Climate Change - Mitigation
Reproductive, Maternal, Newborn and Child Health (RMNCH)

title.narrative: Building a Coalition and Amplifying Voices. Research, advocacy messages, short briefings and knowledge products generated, shared and used on women’s rights and enabling factors among coalition members and allied development and feminist groups.

ICRW will present their findings in key fora and convene events to share the knowledge products. Presentations will take place at SEEP, Women Deliver, CSW, the World Bank spring meetings, and at other events in New York, Seattle, and Atlanta or in Africa.
ICRW plans for a minimum of 5 senior staff presentations on the substance of their research over the 24 months. ICRW will share the policy briefs and country reports, blogs and op-eds produced under Output 1 and track the quantity of knowledge products and research outputs, shared and used, social media activity reporting the discussions and coalition events, shared messaging emphasizing rights and enabling environments. ICRW will also co-produce up to 5 blogs, op-eds and/or “position pieces” with CWEE coalition members and allied groups for dissemination in these fora and meetings.

target.value: Limited and siloed research and policy advocacy materials on rights and enabling factors that support WEE

Increasing production of shared research and policy advocacy materials on rights and enabling factors that support WEE. ICRW will track number of research products and policy advocacy materials. blogs. op-eds. policy briefs. etc.
Shared knowledge products used. platforms engaged. quantitative analysis of social media exchanges. downloads. website metrics. citations.

Increasing production of research and policy advocacy materials on rights and enabling factors that support WEE. # of research products and policy advocacy materials. blogs. op-eds. policy briefs. etc.
Shared knowledge products used. platforms engaged. quantitative analysis of social media exchanges. downloads. website metrics. citations.

title.narrative: Going Beyond Finance to Rights. ICRW knowledge products and advocacy materials developed on enabling factors, social norm change and parallel investments that are critical for women entrepreneurs in addition to financial services.

target.value: Limited reference to women’s rights and enabling factors in multilateral WEE initiatives

Increasing reference to women’s rights and enabling factors in multilateral WEE initiatives (qualitative analysis of speeches. website materials and programs and budgets). Quantitative analysis of the use of knowledge products. number of blogs and op-eds. downloads and website metrics. Qualitative analysis of 5 interviews with target key informants.

Increasing reference to women’s rights and enabling factors in multilateral WEE initiatives (qualitative analysis of speeches. website materials and programs and budgets). Quantitative analysis of the use of knowledge products. number of blogs and op-eds. downloads and website metrics. Qualitative analysis of interviews with 5 target key informants.

title.narrative: Technical Assistance for the Danish Embassy. Briefing notes developed on key aspects of WEE and enabling factors for Danish delegations and visiting dignitaries.
8 short briefing notes, up to 4 in-person briefings

target.value: Up to 4 sets of short briefing notes and 2 in person briefings
Additional 4 sets of briefing notes and remainder of briefings

title.narrative: There will be a greater focus on enabling factors, social norm change, parallel investments in WEE and women’s rights to social protection and health in economic empowerment initiatives

Analysis of speeches, key documents, website materials, programs, conference materials. ICRW will code for key words that exhibit more nuance and pay reference to the critical enabling factors such as rights to productive resources, social protection and health. ICRW will code, count and rank qualitative changes in the use of these words and link them to changings in key programming initiatives.

target.value: Increase in reference to and relevance of enabling factors. social norm change and parallel investments in key public documents and program descriptions. Shift in any funding allocated to the enabling environment referenced in program documents for WeFi or in other WEE initiatives over time.
